instruments.name: Violin
instruments.description: A versatile string instrument with a warm, rich tone.
instruments.longDescription: The violin, often considered the 'prima donna' of the orchestra, boasts a vocal-like quality that can soar with passion or whisper with tenderness. Its four strings are typically tuned in perfect fifths, producing a truly captivating sound whether played solo or within a grand symphony.
instruments.joke: Why did the violin get sent to detention? Because it was always fiddling around!
instruments.funFact: Stradivarius violins, made by the Stradivari family in the 17th and 18th centuries, are considered among the finest string instruments ever made, often selling for millions of dollars.

instruments.name: Guitar
instruments.description: A classic acoustic guitar with steel strings, perfect for any genre.
instruments.longDescription: From campfire singalongs to stadium rock anthems, the guitar is arguably the most popular instrument worldwide. Its versatility allows it to be strummed, plucked, or fingerpicked, providing rhythm, melody, and harmony across countless musical styles.
instruments.joke: What do you call a guitar player without a girlfriend? Homeless.
instruments.funFact: The world's most expensive guitar ever sold was Kurt Cobain's 1959 Martin D-18E, which fetched a staggering $6 million at auction.

instruments.name: Piano
instruments.description: A grand piano offering a wide dynamic range and expressive sound.
instruments.longDescription: The piano, often called the 'king of instruments', is capable of producing a vast range of sounds, from thunderous lows to delicate highs. Its 88 keys provide a unique tactile and sonic experience, making it a cornerstone of classical, jazz, and popular music.
instruments.joke: What's a piano's favorite type of candy? A 'key' lime pie!
instruments.funFact: The word 'piano' is a shortened version of 'pianoforte', which means 'soft-loud' in Italian, referring to the instrument's ability to play at different volumes depending on how hard the keys are pressed.

instruments.name: Trumpet
instruments.description: A brass instrument known for its bright, powerful sound.
instruments.longDescription: The trumpet's bright and piercing tone cuts through an ensemble, making it ideal for fanfares, jazz solos, and orchestral highlights. It's a challenging instrument to master, requiring precise breath control and lip tension to produce its characteristic sound.
instruments.joke: Why did the trumpet player cross the road? To blow his own horn!
instruments.funFact: The earliest trumpets, dating back to 1500 BC, were used in ancient Egypt not for music, but for military signals and religious ceremonies.

instruments.name: Drum Kit
instruments.description: A full professional drum kit for powerful rhythmic foundations.
instruments.longDescription: The drum kit is the rhythmic backbone of most modern music. Comprising various drums and cymbals, it allows a single musician to create complex rhythmic patterns that drive the energy and feel of a song. It's all about precision, power, and groove!
instruments.joke: What's a drummer's favorite type of pizza? One with a good 'beat'!
instruments.funFact: Before the invention of the modern drum kit, multiple percussionists were needed to play all the different drums and cymbals that one drummer can now play simultaneously.

instruments.name: Microphone
instruments.description: Studio-grade condenser microphone for crystal-clear vocal recording.
instruments.longDescription: While not an 'instrument' in the traditional sense, a good microphone is essential for capturing the nuances of vocals and acoustic instruments. It's the bridge between the sound waves in the air and the electrical signals that can be recorded and amplified.
instruments.joke: Why did the microphone break up with the speaker? Because they had too many 'sound' arguments!
instruments.funFact: The earliest successful microphone, the carbon microphone, was independently developed by David Edward Hughes in England and Emile Berliner and Thomas Edison in the US in the 1870s.

reviews.name: Adi
reviews.text: The team was super professional and made my first music session extremely good.

reviews.name: Sunil K
reviews.text: Very good sound quality and fine-tuned equipment overall!

reviews.name: Liam D
reviews.text: The expertise and patience makes me highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Maria R
reviews.text: Amazing facilities and very professional staff. Highly recommended!

feedbacks.message: The session in Studio A was incredible! The acoustics are top-notch and the engineer was super helpful. Will definitely be back.
A great, cozy space for solo vocal work. Everything was set up and ready to go when I arrived.
